newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks seen up on carry-over, peso firm.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks seen up on carry-over, peso firm.

text.p: Dealers said they saw stocks opening with upside potential on Thursday in a continuation of Wednesday's advance, although they said volume would be moderate and did not rule out intraday profit-taking.
"There were buyers in at the close yesterday and we expect them to carry over to the open," a desk trader said.
Technical analysts placed resistance for the IPC index at 4,775 points, up from Wednesday's close of 4,742.12.
Traders expected the peso to open firm on demand for stocks and optimism ahead of inflation data due out later Thursday.
Dealers forecast a trading range of 7.8150/7.8350 per dollar for the 48-hour peso. Pre-open bids stood at 7.8260/7.8295 per dollar, compared to Wednesday's close of 7.8280/7.8330.
Overnight rates on Cetes were seen edging down from the prior close of 17.40 percent on a firm peso and the U.S. 30-year Treasury bond, which was up 7/32 to yield 6.42 percent in early trade.
